clinical_study.brief_title: Imatinib Mesylate in Patients With Refractory Desmoplastic Small Round Cell Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label Trial of Imatinib Mesylate in Patients With Refractory Desmoplastic Small Round Cell Tumors (DSRCT) Expressing PDGF-R

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label, non-comparative study conducted to investigate the activity and safety of imatinib mesylate in refractory desmoplastic small round cell tumors expressing PDGF-R. Patients will be treated up to 12 months, or to disease progression. Tumor will be evaluated according to Recist criteria

primary_outcome.description: An imaging technique (CT scan or MRI) determined tumor response according to RECIST criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Explore how Imatinib cooperated with other treatment modatilities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Survival data was collected until death
secondary_outcome.description: Recorded survival after treatment and other associated treatment modalities.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Safety data collected until patients were no longer in study

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed actual resectability rate after therapy compared to resectability before therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mutational analysis of molecular targets of imatinib (at any time during the study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At any time during the study

clinical_study.condition: Refractory Desmoplastic Small Round Cell Tumors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients > 16 years of age.
2. Histologically documented diagnosis of DSRCT, unresponsive or in no complete remission after any conventional multimodality approach.
3. Immunohistochemical documentation of activated PDGF-R expression by tumor
4. At least one measurable site of disease
5. Performance status 0,1, 2 or 3 (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group)
6. Adequate end organ function
Exclusion criteria:
1. Patient has received any other investigational agents within 28 days of first day of study drug dosing, unless the disease is rapidly progressing.
2. Patient is < 5 years free of another primary malignancy
3. Patient with congestive heart failure or myocardial infarction within 6 months of study
4. Female patients who are pregnant or breast-feeding.
5. Severe and/or uncontrolled medical disease
6. Known brain metastasis.
7. Chronic active hepatitis or cirrhosis
8. Known diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection.
9. Chemotherapy within 4 weeks prior to study entry, unless the disease is rapidly progressing.
10. Previous radiotherapy to > 25 % of the bone marrow
11. Major surgery within 2 weeks prior to study entry.
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
